ltl2rabin

Class Automaton.State<R,S>

  • Object
    • ltl2rabin.Automaton.State<R,S>
  • Type Parameters:
    R - The type of the labels of the states.
    S - The type of the letters the automaton runs on.
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    MojmirAutomaton.State, RabinAutomaton.State
    Enclosing class:
    Automaton<T,U>

    public abstract static class Automaton.State<R,S>
extends Object
    The abstract base class for all states. A state is an object that has a label and can transition into another state of the same type by reading a letter.

      abstract Automaton.State<R,S> readLetter(S letter)
      Return the State of same type that is reached after "reading" a letter (usually this is formally denoted by δ(q, ν).

    • Method Detail

      • readLetter

        public abstract Automaton.State<R,S> readLetter(S letter)
        Return the State of same type that is reached after "reading" a letter (usually this is formally denoted by δ(q, ν).

        Every State has outgoing transitions. A transition maps a letter to a State. How the transitions are stored depends on the implementation of Automaton.State and Automaton.

        Note: Since the base class only describes deterministic automata the transitions are deterministic.

        Parameters:
        letter - The letter (ν) that is consumed by the transition
        Returns:
        The state the letter maps to
